result.execSummary:
The defendant Tony D. Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tony D. Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Commitment posted in full Dane Co
of Warrant cancellation-posted commitment in Full-Dane Co
Defendant's copy of Notice of Certification returned undeliverable - Unable to Forward per USPS

Defendant Tony D. Smith in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Defendant Tony D. Smith in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee moves to amend Ct 1 to Misd. Possession of THC, contrary to 961.41(3g)(e).  State will recommend jail and court costs.  No objection by Atty Klopp.  BY THE COURT:  Court accepts the amendment to the charge.
Defendant enters No Contest plea to the amended Ct 1.  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court questions Atty Klopp.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of amended Ct 1.

BY THE COURT:
Court sentences defendant to serve 30 days in the Marquette County Jail, concurrent to any sentence he is now serving.  Sentence to commence forthwith.  *Pay costs of $243.00.  *Pay $200.00 DNA surcharge.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month, commencing upon release from prison (in approx. 10 months)

records.descr: Petition for writ of habeas corpus

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing on January 7, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Tony D. Smith in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Defendant Tony D. Smith in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that this was set for a bond review.  Atty Hendee states that the defendant requested a speedy trial and the matter was not done in time and states that per statute the defendant would be released from bond conditions.
Atty Klopp states that the defendant did request a speedy trial in which this has not been done within the 90 days and asks that the court release the defendant from bond and release the cash to the party that posted it.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant should be released from bond based on the defendant's request for speedy trial in which the matter had not been held within 90 days.
Cash to be returned to the party that posted it.
ORDER TO PRODUCE
Bail/bond hearing on September 24, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
from Atty Hendee asking the court to release the defendant from bond; per Judge set bond review hearing.
Bail/bond hearing on September 24, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial on November 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Motion to Suppress Fruits of Vehicle Search
Defendeant's Motion to Suppress Statements
Defendanat's Requested Jury Instructions
PLAINTIFF'S
Jury trial on September 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant received a copy of the information & waives it's reading.    Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

Atty Klopp requests a speedy trial.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
Set for Trial.
bond continued.

Defendant Tony D. Smith in court with attorney Roger L Klopp.  Defendant Tony D. Smith in custody.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that he has received certified copies of the prior convictions and ask the court to find probable cause and bind over.
Atty Klopp has received certified copies of the prior convictions.
  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the court.  Jury trial scheduled for September 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
copy of certified JOC from Dane County
ORDER TO PRODUCE
Status conference on June 26, 2014 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Tony D. Smith in court with attorney Roger L Klopp.  Defendant Tony D. Smith in custody.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the parties are prepared to proceed today; however the State asks the court to take judicial notice on the prior offenses.
Atty Klopp responds and states that proof has not been provided of prior convictions.  Atty Hendee asks to begin the Preliminary Hearing and requests to adjourn to get certified copies of the prior convictions.

BY THE COURT:  Court will allow the Prelim to continue without the certified copy of the prior convictions.  
Court gives the State until June 25, 2014 to file the certified copies of the prior convictions.

Officer Joe Stolpa called and sworn.  Examined by Atty Hendee.
Cross-examined by Atty Klopp.
witness excused.

Atty Hendee requests the court to find probable cause and a bind over.
Atty Klopp makes arguments.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.    Pending certified copy of the prior convictions from Atty Hendee which needs to be filed by Wednesday, June 25, 2014.  If not, the parties may request a hearing.
Hold open case for bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee asks the court how information would like to be handled.  Atty Hendee requests a Status/Arraignment shortly after the bind over.
Atty Klopp has no issue with the information being filed 30 days after the bind over.
  Status conference scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 04:00 pm.
ORDER TO PRODUCE
cash bond was posted in
Preliminary hearing on June 19, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Tony D. Smith in court, in custody.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court states that Atty Klopp contacted his office this morning that he will be representing the defendant; court excused appearance today.

BY THE COURT:  Court will set for Preliminary Hearing.
bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 19, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Initial appearance on June 2, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Tony D. Smith in court, in custody.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Atty Hendee requests $250 cash bond.  Defendant makes statement.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
